ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Steps of building and carrying out an experiment
Full cycle of psycholinguistic experimental design.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths:
- Experiencing running an experiment on your own
Weaknesses:
- There could be more specific workshopping, maybe we could have guest lectures from grad students or profs who could come in to give us basics on how to build (code) an experiment (if needed), the options available to do so, basic data analysis help, pseudo-randomization, the purpose of fillers (to better build them), etc.

The workshopping was great and very helpful, but it took a lot of class time and each person needed to remind the others what is the research question. Sometimes, it became a conversation between the instructor and the presenting student. The course might have been even smoother if in the second half of the course the workshopping is individual consultation between students and the instructor. In the first half, I would have liked to learn something more practical, such as choosing among different platforms/software for experimentation, the statistical tests to choose, etc. That said, I liked the course and it helped me (and us) to make a lot of progress.
Strength: detailed comments from the instructor, the chance to closely follow other students' work.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes for students who want practical experimental design experience -- this is not a theoretical course.
